pageContext.claim: Democrats "promised Obamacare would reduce premiums by $2,500. Instead, premiums have skyrocketed by numbers that nobody can even believe – sometimes, many many thousands of dollars.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump takes a misleading GOP talking point and hypes it up even more – that premiums “went up to levels that nobody thought possible.” Health costs for employer-provided plans have grown much slower than expected since the Affordable Care Act was implemented. Experts debate whether the ACA played a significant role, but the average family premium is now almost $3,600 lower than if premium growth had kept pace with the rate in the decade before the law was passed, {according to the Kaiser Family Foundation.}
